name: Mitigation Playbook for Malicious PowerShell Script Execution Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where an attacker executed a malicious PowerShell script designed to extract sensitive data and establish persistence on several compromised machines.

action--5b49e8c6-299b-4d78-bdc3-1675e6a4.name: Kill malicious PowerShell process
action--5b49e8c6-299b-4d78-bdc3-1675e6a4.description: Terminate any PowerShell processes that may be executing the malicious script.

if-condition--f1b4ae84-c6a0-4df5-bd91-a0.name: Check if any PowerShell process exists

action--1a3c8d2e-9f4e-48d0-8d8f-2fb09d27.name: Isolate affected hosts
action--1a3c8d2e-9f4e-48d0-8d8f-2fb09d27.description: Disable firewall profiles to isolate the affected hosts.

commands.command: netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off

while-condition--b3c7b7c3-bef6-47cb-8e94.name: Isolate hosts loop
while-condition--b3c7b7c3-bef6-47cb-8e94.description: Repeat until all hosts are detected as isolated.

action--ae1f6875-618a-4910-b9fa-0e65f2c3.name: Run virus scan
action--ae1f6875-618a-4910-b9fa-0e65f2c3.description: Perform a virus scan in the suspected directory to identify any remnants of the attack.

commands.command: clamscan -r /path/to/suspected/files > scan_output; if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo 'Scan Alert: Possible Malicious Files Detected' > scan_alert; fi
